abstract: International House Hunting column; three-bedroom 1910 stone villa on Lapad Bay in Adriatic Sea, near Dubrovnik, Croatia, is listed at $2.73 million; market and tips for buying in Croatia highlighted.
snippet: Although prices fell as much as 30 percent after the 2008 global financial crisis, the housing market in Croatia has stabilized in recent years, and Dubrovnik remains the most expensive.
lead_paragraph: Although prices fell as much as 30 percent after the 2008 global financial crisis, the housing market in Croatia has stabilized in recent years, and Dubrovnik remains the most expensive.
